thread.title: Commonwealth Bank on track for $5bn capital boost after raising $2.1bn from institutions
thread.title_full: Commonwealth Bank on track for $5bn capital boost after raising $2.1bn from institutions | Business News | Business and Finance News | | The Advertiser

author: Mitchell Neems
title: Commonwealth Bank on track for $5bn capital boost after raising $2.1bn from institutions
text:
COMMONWEALTH Bank shares have dipped after resuming trading today following the launch last week of the group’s $5 billion capital raising program.
Shares in the group, Australia’s biggest lender, fell more than 2 per cent in early today in their first trading session since the capital raising was announced last Wednesday.
They recovered some ground later but still down 0.8 per cent at $81.475 in early afternoon trade.
The share price slide pales in comparison to the 7.5 per cent dive in ANZ shares earlier in August after it announced a $3 billion raising.
CBA has received $2.1 billion from institutional shareholders since the announcement and will now look to raise the rest from retail shareholders through a renounceable entitlement offer.
The bank announced the cash call last week as it delivered yet another record full-year profit.
CBA today said the institutional entitlement offer and institutional bookbuild had been completed and collectively raised around $2.1 billion.
“The institutional entitlement offer attracted strong demand, with approximately 90 per cent of entitlements being exercised by eligible institutional shareholders,” the lender said.
The retail component of the entitlement offer is expected to raise the remaining $3 billion and will open on August 24 and close on September 8.
The big four banks have been under increasing pressure to bolster their capital positions ahead of new rules coming into effect from next July.
From July 2016, the big four banks will be required to hold increased ‘common equity tier one’ capital ratios, and mortgage ‘risk weights’ of at least 25 per cent.
The move follows NAB’s $5.5bn capital raising in June, and ANZ’s $3bn capital raising last week.
with AAP
Commonwealth Bank (Frame content direct link: http://markets.theaustralian.com.au/embed/CBA/640 .)
The Australian
 CBA shares fall as trading resumes
